intro: Rhynchospora cabecarae, commonly known as the Cabecara sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in wetland and marshy environments. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Rhynchospora cabecarae plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various invertebrates and birds.
